verses.text: Thinkest thou this to be right, \add That\add* thou saidst, My righteousness \add is\add* more than Godâ€™s?
For thou saidst, What advantage will it be unto thee? \add And\add*, What profit shall I have, \add if I be cleansed\add* from my sin?
I will answer thee, And thy companions with thee.
Look unto the heavens, and see; And behold the clouds \add which\add* are higher than thou.
If thou sinnest, what doest thou against him? Or \add if\add* thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto him?
If thou be righteous, what givest thou him? Or what receiveth he of thine hand?
Thy wickedness \add may hurt\add* a man as thou \add art;\add* And thy righteousness \add may profit\add* the son of man.
By reason of the multitude of oppressions they make \add the oppressed\add* to cry: They cry out by reason of the arm of the mighty.
But none saith, Where \add is\add* God my Maker, Who giveth songs in the night;
Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, And maketh us wiser than the fowls of heaven?
There they cry, but none giveth answer, Because of the pride of evil men.
Surely God will not hear vanity, Neither will the Almighty regard it.
Although thou sayest thou shalt not see him, \add Yet\add* judgment \add is\add* before him; therefore trust thou in him.
But now, because \add it is\add* not \add so\add*, he hath visited \add in\add* his anger; Yet he knoweth \add it\add* not in great extremity:
Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; He multiplieth words without knowledge.
